<?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf8'?>
<result id="8fdb09bd-77a6-4e8c-af4d-538d12a6b5b4"><name>FTP Unencrypted Cleartext Login</name><owner><name>admin</name></owner><comment /><creation_time>2020-01-29T20:15:02Z</creation_time><modification_time>2020-01-29T20:15:02Z</modification_time><user_tags><count>0</count></user_tags><host>0.0.0.1<asset asset_id="" /></host><port>21/tcp</port><nvt oid="1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.108528"><type>nvt</type><name>FTP Unencrypted Cleartext Login</name><family>General</family><cvss_base>4.8</cvss_base><cve>NOCVE</cve><bid>NOBID</bid><xref>NOXREF</xref><tags>cvss_base_vector=AV:A/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N|summary=The remote host is running a FTP service that allows cleartext logins over
  unencrypted connections.|impact=An attacker can uncover login names and passwords by sniffing traffic to the
  FTP service.|vuldetect=Tries to login to a non FTPS enabled FTP service without sending a
  'AUTH TLS' command first and checks if the service is accepting the login without enforcing the use of
  the 'AUTH TLS' command.|solution=Enable FTPS or enforce the connection via the 'AUTH TLS' command. Please see
  the manual of the FTP service for more information.|solution_type=Mitigation|qod_type=remote_analysis</tags><cert /></nvt><scan_nvt_version>$Revision: 13026 $</scan_nvt_version><threat>Medium</threat><severity>4.8</severity><qod><value>70</value><type>remote_analysis</type></qod><description>The remote FTP service accepts logins without a previous sent 'AUTH TLS' command. Response(s):

Anonymous sessions:     331 Password required for anonymous.
Non-anonymous sessions: 331 Password required for AppCheck-NG-vt.</description><original_threat>Medium</original_threat><original_severity>4.8</original_severity><notes /><overrides /></result>

items.title: FTP Unencrypted Cleartext Login

details.Impact: [[markup]]An attacker can uncover login names and passwords by sniffing traffic to the   FTP service.
details.Detection: [[markup]]Tries to login to a non FTPS enabled FTP service without sending a   'AUTH TLS' command first and checks if the service is accepting the login without enforcing the use of   the 'AUTH TLS' command.
details.Technical Details:
The remote FTP service accepts logins without a previous sent 'AUTH TLS' command. Response(s):

Anonymous sessions:     331 Password required for anonymous.
Non-anonymous sessions: 331 Password required for appcheck-ng-vt.

items.description:
The remote host is running a FTP service that allows cleartext logins over
  unencrypted connections.
items.solution: [[markup]]Enable FTPS or enforce the connection via the 'AUTH TLS' command. Please see   the manual of the FTP service for more information.
items.synopsis:
The remote host is running a FTP service that allows cleartext logins over
  unencrypted connections.
